response: "{ \"title\": \"Hard: Perfect Numbers\", \"description\": \"A perfect number is a positive integer that is equal to the sum of its proper divisors, excluding itself. For example, 6 is a perfect number because it has four proper divisors (1, 2, 3) and their sum is equal to 6. Write a function `is_perfect_number` that checks if a given integer is a perfect number.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_perfect_number(n: int) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): A positive integer.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if the input integer is a perfect number, `False` otherwise.\\n\", \"code\": \"\\nimport math\\n\\ndef is_perfect_number(n: int) -> bool:\\n    sum_divisors = 0\\n    for i in range(1, n):\\n        if n % i == 0:\\n            sum_divisors += i\\n    return sum_divisors == n\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_perfect_number(6) == True\", \"assert is_perfect_number(28) == True\", \"assert is_perfect_number(4) == False\", \"assert is_perfect_number(3) == False\"] }"
